definition: to start a war/to make war/to battle against

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: He's got a new movie opening soon.
sentences.chinese: 他的另一部新作马上要开战首映。

sentences.english: The waiting is over. The World Cup is about to kick off.
sentences.chinese: 漫长的等待终于结束了，南非世界杯即将鸣锣开战。

sentences.english: We will wage guerrilla warfare against the Burmese army if conflict breaks out.
sentences.chinese: 如果开战，我们会针对缅甸政府军发起游击战。

sentences.english: Edward struck first, and overwhelmed the younger de Montfort.
sentences.chinese: 爱德华首先开战，并打败了年轻的孟福尔。

sentences.english: But his move also underscores the frustration of trying to do battle against the amorphous online community.
sentences.chinese: 但是他的行动却是试图与整个无组织的网络社区开战。

sentences.english: The White House made no comment Friday on the anniversary of the start of the war.
sentences.chinese: 星期五，白宫对伊战开战纪念日无任何评论。

sentences.english: China is despo to show off her military power, looking for a reason to start war.
sentences.chinese: 中国急切想炫耀军事实力，正在找一个理由开战。

sentences.english: Zaiyi advised to kill the foreigners and fight against the foreign countries.
sentences.chinese: 主张杀洋人，杀教民，与外国开战。

sentences.english: The ancient Greeks sacrificed lambs or calves to the gods before engaging in battle.
sentences.chinese: 古希腊人在开战前用羊羔或牛犊祭神。

sentences.english: Warring with the mainstream media is standard republican foolery.
sentences.chinese: 对主流媒体开战是共和党典型的愚蠢行为。

sentences.english: Constantine went to war with the other guy on the other side, and he won.
sentences.chinese: 君士坦丁和对面的家伙开战，胜利了。

sentences.english: By 1958, Communist-led guerrillas known as the Viet Cong had begun to battle the South Vietnamese government.
sentences.chinese: 1958年，越共游击队即越共开始与南越政府开战。

sentences.english: Rukia sighed and started working, for once not trying to start a fight.
sentences.chinese: 露琪亚叹了口气，然后开始工作，这一次不要开战。

sentences.english: War of resistance against aggression wins, country in all battle, does Chinese whereto go?
sentences.chinese: 抗战胜利，国共开战，中国向何处去？

sentences.english: A TAX dispute as old as mail-order catalogues turned into warfare this month.
sentences.chinese: 一项跟邮购目录一样古老的税务纠纷在这个月开战了。

sentences.english: "Do you disapprove, nanna?" Justine growled, ready to do battle.
sentences.chinese: “你不赞成吗？外婆？”贾斯丁咆哮着，准备开战了。

definition: (of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
to go to war/to engage in war
to start a war/to open hostilities
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
to start shooting or firing/to win an initial success/to succeed (of a plan)
